TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit FederationMessage extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the base class from which all federation message classes derive.

block.para: At a minimum, you must override the property and the method in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: protected FederationMessage (Uri baseUrl);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri baseUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: The base URL to which the federation message applies. Initializes the property.
Docs.summary: Called from constructors in derived classes to initialize the class.
Docs.exception: is not a valid, absolute URI.

MemberSignature.Value: public Uri BaseUri { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Uri BaseUri

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the base URL to which the message applies.
Docs.value: A that contains the base URL.
Docs.exception: An attempt to set a value that is occurs.
An attempt to set a value that is not a valid URI occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Uri GetBaseUrl (Uri uri);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Uri GetBaseUrl(class System.Uri uri) cil managed

Docs.param: The URI from which to extract the base URL.
Docs.summary: Helper method that extracts the base URL from the specified URI.
Docs.returns: The base URL that was extracted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The URL returned is the original URL without the query string.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetParameter (string parameter);
.method public hidebysig instance string GetParameter(string parameter) cil managed

Docs.param: The parameter for which to search.
Docs.summary: Returns the specified parameter value from the parameters dictionary.
Docs.returns: The value of the parameter or if the parameter does not exist.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The parameters dictionary is accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.Parameters%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> Parameters { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> Parameters

Docs.summary: Gets the message parameters as a dictionary.
Docs.value: A dictionary that contains the message parameters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A dictionary of name and value pairs that contains the parameters in the message. The parameters are keyed by the parameter name. For example, to retrieve the value of the wattr parameter, use "wattr".

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection ParseQueryString (Uri data);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection ParseQueryString(class System.Uri data) cil managed

Docs.summary: Helper method that parses the query string in the specified URI into a .
Docs.returns: A that contains the parameters in the query string.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RemoveParameter (string parameter);
.method public hidebysig instance void RemoveParameter(string parameter) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the parameter to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes a parameter from the parameters dictionary.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The parameters dictionary is accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.Parameters%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetParameter (string parameter, string value);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetParameter(string parameter, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the parameter to set.
The value to be assigned to the parameter.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a parameter in the parameters dictionary.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the parameter does not exist in the dictionary, it is added to it. The parameters dictionary is accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.Parameters%2A> property.

Docs.exception:
is or an empty string.
-or-
is or an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetUriParameter (string parameter, string value);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetUriParameter(string parameter, string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the value of a parameter in the parameters dictionary. The value must be an absolute URI.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the parameter does not exist in the dictionary, it is added. The parameters dictionary is accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.Parameters%2A> property.

Docs.exception:
is .
-or-
is or not an absolute URI.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void Validate ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Validate() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation checks whether the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.BaseUri%2A> property contains an absolute URI.

Docs.exception: The value of the property is or is not an absolute URI.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Write (System.IO.TextWriter writer);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Write(class System.IO.TextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The text writer to which the message is written out.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes the message to the output stream.

block.para: You must override this method in derived classes. Your implementation should validate the message and throw an appropriate exception before writing it.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string WriteFormPost ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string WriteFormPost() cil managed

Docs.summary: Serializes the message as a form post and returns the resulting Form together with its Javascript as a string.
Docs.returns: A string representation of the message as a Form together with its associated Javascript.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string WriteQueryString ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string WriteQueryString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of the message in query-string format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates a message that is composed of the URL specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.BaseUri%2A> property followed by a query string that is created from the parameters dictionary. The parameters dictionary is accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.Parameters%2A> property.
